parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front brakes can cause extended stopping distances, increased risk of accidents, and loss of control of the vehicle, which can lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The ABS light illuminates on the dashboard
the vehicle continues to accelerate when attempting to make a normal stop

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to loss of compression, coolant, and oil, which can result in engine damage, stalling, and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: The vehicle overheats without registering on the temperature gauge

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the automatic transmission can cause the engine to die, leading to loss of power and control, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: and the vehicle may experience slipping or hesitation while shifting gears.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rocker arm shaft can cause the driver to lose engine cylinders, leading to loss of power and control, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: causing the driver to lose engine cylinders
and the vehicle may experience decreased engine performance

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the exhaust system can cause noise, vibration, and potentially lead to decreased engine performance, which can result in decreased vehicle safety and performance.
symptoms: and the vehicle may experience vibration
